alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 8:32PM CDT until May 29 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Cambridge affecting Furnas County. For the REPUBLICAN RIVER...including Cambridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Cambridge...with this Warning also valid for the entire Furnas County stretch of the river. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs as the right bank overflows. Water will start flowing through sloughs south of the main channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.8 feet and very slowly rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue a very gradual rise Saturday night into Sunday, before cresting around the 9.0 foot minor flood stage around 7 PM Sunday evening. It will then gradually fall below flood stage Sunday night into Monday morning. Please note that river is now expected to reach minor flood stage in the Cambridge area later than previously forecast, and there is even some question whether it will actually reach minor flood stage or perhaps fall just short. One factor that could potentially alter the current forecast is at least some possibility for localized heavy rain over the Republican River basin Sunday morning, which if it occurs could result in increased flooding potential. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 04/25/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
